title: Quiz 2: Data Collection Tools & Reporting
description: Assess your knowledge of specific Ministry of Health (MOH) data collection tools and reporting protocols.

questions.question: Match the MOH Tool Code to its correct Description:
questions.hint: 513 is for households, 514 is the daily diary.

questions.question: How frequently should the **MOH 513 Household Register** be updated?
questions.explanation: The MOH 513 Household Register is updated every six months and submitted to the CHEWs.
questions.hint: It serves as baseline data and isn't updated daily.

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ (MOH 516) is used to replicate information from the CHEW summary to share with the community during dialogue days.
questions.explanation: The Chalk Board (MOH 516) is a visual tool used for community feedback.
questions.hint: It is a board you write on with chalk.

questions.question: Which of the following are valid **sources of data** in the community? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Valid sources include registers, surveys, FGDs, observations, and meetings.
questions.hint: Select all formal and structured ways of gathering info.

questions.question:
Look at the scenario below. Which MOH tool should the CHV use?

'A CHV identifies a pregnant woman with danger signs and determines she needs immediate care at the health facility.'

richContent.content: Scenario: Client needs transfer of care from community to facility.

questions.explanation: MOH 100 is the Community Referral Form used to refer clients to a facility.
questions.hint: It involves moving a client to a higher level of care.

questions.question: Data validation can only be done electronically at the county level.
questions.explanation: Data validation can be done manually at the point of collection by the CHC/CHEW and electronically at the sub-county level.
questions.hint: Can validation happen on paper before entering the computer?

questions.question: Order the **Data Flow and Reporting Responsibilities** from the community level upwards:

items.text: Submit Logbook to CHEW for summary

questions.explanation: Data moves from household collection -> Logbook -> CHEW Summary -> Electronic System.
questions.hint: Start with the CHV's daily work.

questions.question: Which tool acts as a 'diary' for the CHV to record daily services and observations?
questions.explanation: MOH 514 Service Delivery Logbook is the daily diary for CHVs.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the **Master Community Health Unit List (MCHUL)**?

options.text: To list all patients in the community
To link community units to the Master Facility List for integration into HMIS

questions.explanation: MCHUL is a web-based list linked to the Master Facility List to integrate CHU data into the national system.
questions.hint: It connects the 'Community Unit' to the 'Facility'.

questions.question: Why is reporting back to the community important? (Select all that apply)

options.text: It is required to punish non-compliant households

questions.explanation: Reporting fosters accountability, informs planning, helps mobilization, and provides feedback, but is not for punishment.
questions.hint: Think about positive outcomes of sharing information.
